metadata.Name: MEE
metadata.Description: MEE is a multilingual event extraction dataset for English and Chinese. It contains 10,000 English sentences and 2,000 Chinese sentences annotated with a uniform, fine-grained event schema. The data was collected from the New York Times and SINA News.
Provider: National Laboratory of Pattern Recognition, Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences
School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences
metadata.Paper Title: MEE: A Novel Multilingual Event Extraction Dataset
metadata.Venue Title: Proceedings of the 2021 Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies
metadata.Venue Name: Conference of the North American Chapter of the Association for Computational Linguistics: Human Language Technologies
Affiliations: National Laboratory of Pattern Recognition, Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences
School of Artificial Intelligence, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences
metadata.Abstract: Event extraction (EE) aims to extract structured event information from unstructured texts, which is a crucial task in information extraction. However, most existing EE datasets are in English, which hinders the development of multilingual EE. In this paper, we introduce MEE, a new multilingual EE dataset with 10,000/2,000 sentences for English/Chinese respectively. We first define a uniform and fine-grained event schema for both languages. Then we propose a cost-effective method to construct the dataset. We conduct comprehensive experiments on MEE to provide benchmarks for future works. The experimental results show that MEE is a challenging dataset for state-of-the-art models. We will release our dataset and codes to promote the research of multilingual EE.
